Match the Azure compute services to the appropriate descriptions.

To answer, drag the appropriate compute service from the column on the left to its description on the right. Each service may be used once, more than once, or not at all.

NOTE: Each correct match is worth one point.

//IMG//

HOTSPOT
-

For each of the following statements, select Yes if the statement is true. Otherwise, select No.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
Here’s the evaluation of the statements based on **Microsoft Purview**:

1. **Microsoft Purview provides data backup.** 
 - **No**: Microsoft Purview is not a backup service. Its focus is on data governance and management, not on creating data backups.

2. **Microsoft Purview provides data discovery.** 
 - **Yes**: Microsoft Purview includes tools for data discovery, helping organizations locate and catalog data across various systems.

3. **Microsoft Purview provides data classification.** 
 - **Yes**: Microsoft Purview enables data classification, assisting organizations in tagging and organizing their data based on sensitivity, type, and other criteria.

Correct 

N -There is nothing mentioned about backup in Microsoft Purview 
Y - "Microsoft Purview provides a robust and coordinated set of data security solutions to help you discover and protect sensitive information."
Y - "Create an up-to-date map of your entire data estate that includes data classification and end-to-end lineage"

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/purview/purview

I believe the solution is correct NYY. I use iASK AI and actually trust its answers, here is what I got from it:
Conclusion

In summary, while Microsoft Purview offers robust tools for managing and governing data, it does not inherently provide capabilities for backing up that data in the way one might expect from dedicated backup solutions. Organizations utilizing Microsoft Purview must implement their own strategies for data backup and recovery.

Answer is YYY Copilot: Yes, Microsoft Purview provides all three: Data Backup, Data Discovery, and Data Classification
. It offers a comprehensive set of solutions to help organizations govern, protect, and manage data across their entire data estate

comments.content:
Im wrong above. It actually provides back up also per Copilot: Yes, Microsoft Purview provides all three: Data Backup, Data Discovery, and Data Classification
It offers a comprehensive set of solutions to help organizations govern, protect, and manage data across their entire data estate

Given answer is correct.

Today, Microsoft Purview doesn't support automated BCDR. Until that support is added, you're responsible to take care of backup and restore activities. You can manually create a secondary Microsoft Purview account as a warm standby instance in another region.

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/purview/disaster-recovery

discussion.content:
CoPilot: The old name for Microsoft Purview was Azure Purview and Microsoft 365 Compliance
. The rebranding consolidated data governance, compliance, and risk management capabilities under a single product name
So it allows for Data classification and Data recovery but not back up.

questions.question_text: Microsoft 365 is an example of which cloud service model?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
True. Microsoft 365 is an example of SaaS.

Selected Answer: C
Microsoft 365 is an example of SaaS

Selected Answer: C
C it is

The answer is C: SaaS.
Microsoft 365, (formerly Office 365) is a Software as a Service (SaaS). 
It provides users access to office productivity apps for email, collaboration, communication, file storage, and more that they can either install on their desktops or access on a web browser.

I will be taking the test Sept 20, 2024. I made sides for each question and used Chat GPT and Copilot to help check answers and compare what was stated in the discussions. I will try to provide an update after my test. Wish me luck.

Ughh got to the last question. But going to do further studying for the more difficult topics or stuff I have already forgotten. Will do the exam middle September probably, now it's holiday time

All the best

NNY
 Azure virtual machines can automatically register their names in Azure DNS private zones when you enable autoregistration for the linked virtual network. This is talking about azure dns private not Azure DNS public.
azure private dns:Providing internal name resolution for Azure VMs and other resources in a private network automatic registration: Yes, if Auto-registration is enabled for linked VNets


azure dns public:Hosting DNS records for publicly accessible websites, APIs, and services
automatic registration:No, requires manual record creation

NYY according to chatgpt
 1: No, Azure DNS supports both public and private DNS.
 2: Yes, Azure VMs can automatically register names in Azure DNS.
3: Yes, Azure DNS can host a custom DNS domain.
